lessonPoints.title: Introduction: Elder Renlund's Message
lessonPoints.summary: Elder Renlund shared a comforting message addressing fears about the Second Coming, reassuring that following the Savior’s teachings can replace anxiety with peace.
lessonPoints.story: Elder Renlund shared a comforting message addressing fears about the Second Coming, reassuring that following the Savior’s teachings can replace anxiety with peace.
lessonPoints.historicalContext: This lesson references Elder Renlund's 2025 General Conference address.

scriptures.verse: And now, verily I say unto you, and what I say unto one I say unto all, be prepared for the wedding; for I will come in an hour when ye think not.

quotes.text: The future is bright for God’s covenant-keeping people.
quotes.author: President Russell M. Nelson

subpoints.explanation: Being spiritually prepared helps reduce anxiety and increase joy as we await the Savior's coming.

scriptures.verse: And if ye are prepared ye shall not fear.

questions: How does preparing spiritually affect your perspective on the future?

lessonPoints.title: Parable of the Ten Virgins
lessonPoints.summary: Jesus taught about ten virgins waiting for the bridegroom, emphasizing personal spiritual preparedness symbolized by the oil in their lamps.
lessonPoints.story: Jesus taught about ten virgins waiting for the bridegroom, emphasizing personal spiritual preparedness symbolized by the oil in their lamps.
lessonPoints.historicalContext: Jesus taught this parable on the Mount of Olives, shortly before His crucifixion, emphasizing the need for constant vigilance and readiness for His return.

scriptures.verse: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.
And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

quotes.text: Covenants anchor us to the Savior.
quotes.author: Elder Dale G. Renlund

subpoints.explanation: Receiving the gospel and making covenants is foundational to spiritual preparedness.

scriptures.verse: Wherefore, be faithful, praying always, having your lamps trimmed and burning, and oil with you, that you may be ready at the coming of the Bridegroom.

subpoints.text: Seek the Holy Ghost as a Guide
subpoints.explanation: Consistent devotion allows the Holy Ghost to guide our daily decisions, filling our lamps with spiritual light.

scriptures.verse: But the Comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.

quotes.text: Daily acts of devotion invite the Spirit.
quotes.author: President Russell M. Nelson

subpoints.explanation: Following prophetic counsel protects us from deception and ensures our spiritual lamps are not extinguished by false lights.

scriptures.verse: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Take heed that no man deceive you. For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.

quotes.text: Trust in true disciples who lead us to Christ.
quotes.author: Elder Dale G. Renlund

questions: How do you ensure you're spiritually prepared daily and keep your lamp burning?

lessonPoints.title: Parable of the Talents
lessonPoints.summary: The master gave talents to three servants, illustrating the expectation to magnify what God has given us and use our gifts wisely.
lessonPoints.story: The master gave talents to three servants, illustrating the expectation to magnify what God has given us and use our gifts wisely.
lessonPoints.historicalContext: This parable was also shared by Jesus shortly before His crucifixion, emphasizing accountability and personal growth in using divine gifts.

scriptures.verse: His lord said unto him, Well done, thou good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

quotes.text: Magnify the abilities God has given you.
quotes.author: Elder Dale G. Renlund

subpoints.explanation: God expects personal growth through our unique talents, whether they be spiritual gifts, leadership skills, or compassion.

scriptures.verse: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath.

subpoints.explanation: Our worth is not measured against others, but in our diligent effort to grow and serve with what we have been given, relying on Christ’s enabling grace.

scriptures.verse: For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself. But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.

quotes.text: The Savior helps us become our best selves.
quotes.author: Elder Dale G. Renlund

questions: What talents do you feel inspired to magnify, and how can you do so without comparing yourself to others?

lessonPoints.title: Parable of the Sheep and Goats
lessonPoints.summary: The Savior taught that our treatment of others reflects our service to Him, emphasizing compassion and kindness, especially to those in need.
lessonPoints.story: The Savior taught that our treatment of others reflects our service to Him, emphasizing compassion and kindness, especially to those in need.
lessonPoints.historicalContext: Jesus taught this parable in the context of His Second Coming, highlighting practical service and love for others as key criteria for eternal judgment.

relatableHymns.title: Because I Have Been Given Much

scriptures.verse: Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

quotes.text: Every act of service is an act of worship.
quotes.author: Elder Dale G. Renlund

subpoints.text: Serve Others as Serving the Savior
subpoints.explanation: Acts of kindness, compassion, and ministering towards others are directly tied to our devotion to Christ, making us more like Him.

scriptures.verse: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

subpoints.explanation: Using our gifts and resources to support vulnerable individuals, including the hungry, sick, or imprisoned, reflects Christ-like love and prepares us for His return.

scriptures.verse: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

quotes.text: Service is the essence of discipleship.
quotes.author: Elder Dale G. Renlund

questions: Who can you serve this week, and how does that service help you prepare to meet the Savior?
